productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Hopefully I had a sample before purchasing it. It's too matifiying for me. I could see little lines on my face that I won't see with any other moisturizer (and don't forget this tends to be a moisturizer, and not a bb cream!) and my face felt a little bit dry. Also, my eyelids got really sticky when I closed my eyes...

This product is a good choice if you are avoiding chemicals uv filters (and also if you avoid that white cast of mineral sunscreens). But it didn't work for me... I wish I like it because it has really good ingredients.

If you have oily skin, you may like it!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Best Daytime Eyelid Cream for extremely oily lids.

Some background on my eyelids.  They get super oily/sebumy.  You know what breaks down water proof makeup?  Oil.  So, waterproof formulas only work for me when I'm sweating, and my eyelids natural oil production breaks down such formulas.  Eyelid primers such as Milani or UDPP don't work for me.  Too Faced works a little better.  Nyx waterproof is my favorite drugstore and Nars Smudgeproof is my HG.
I like using a lot of SPF during the day, layering SPF makeup over my regular SPF.

Around my eyes, I prefer mineral/physical titanium dioxide or zinc oxide because it doesn't sting.  *Fun fact:  zinc oxide offers a wee bit better UVA protection*.  

Most formulas are too moist on my eyelid and make my eye makeup slick off.  Even on non-makeup days, I feel any SPF is slicking off and not offering any protection.

This however, keeps my eyelid and lower lashline matte and protected with no stinging at all.

By itself, this works extremely well as an eyelid primer but I use Benefit Air Patrol just to have a base especially for use on eyelids.  Thanks to this, I no longer have to use Air Patrol too close to my lashline, where it tends to sting a bit.  By itself, its smooth and keeps eyeshadow lasting but doesn't quite help eyeshadow "popping" or looking improved on me.

The tint isn't too noticeable on my ochre NC30 skintone, especially when I cover up with makeup, though it is a more neutral-toned than my skin.

On non-makeup days, this works really well and feels like it's not going anywhere.  On active days, it layers really well on top of itself without feeling heavy.

If you have smaller, extremely oily and sensitive areas, I really recommend this as a daytime cream.  If you have really oily and sensitive skin all over your face, I think there are cheaper options out there like from Neutrogena Healthy Defense SPF 50 or Coppertone Oil-Free SPF 30.  Since I use this as a daytime eye cream, a little goes a long way.

Either way, the ingredient list is beautiful and the price is pretty justifiable, especially when there are sales or coupon codes.  If you have issues with SPF and oil production, I'd give this a go.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I suppose this is the closest I will get to strongly liking a Paula's Choice product. I've tried a bunch, this was my favorite.

Despite following the 1/4 tsp rule & avoiding the sun; I still wish this was SPF 50 rather than SPF 30. The price is pretty steep too because I pay about half for better protection from Asian brands. HOWEVER with my Rosacea, I began growing paranoid about what chemical UV filters could be doing to my skin. So I decided to search some more options. This P.C sunscreen is strictly zinc oxide (meaning physical UV filters). Zinc Oxide tends to be gentler on sensitive skin.

Paula's Choice RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense sunscreen is tinted. I am extremely pale leaning neutral. I match with MAC's NC10 at my darkest. This sunscreen is WAY too dark for me. It's about NW15-20. Initially I was either going to throw it away or save it for spray tans.  Recently I read about pale girls wearing too-dark tinted sunscreen under their foundation & I was inspired to try this. My favorite foundation is super full coverage. It had no trouble covering this, because the coverage of the tint in the sunscreen is sheer. Perfect. ***If you are wondering why so many companies ruin formulations of physical SS by adding a tint, it's to avoid whitecast***

The antioxidants in this product should help boost the sun protection efficiency. I like that this was moisturizing enough to smooth out flakes & help my foundation glide on. It isn't thick, nor greasy.  But what I liked more than that, was it dried to a demi-matte finish. I've always said that a good sunscreen is a good primer.

All in all this is a decent sunscreen. Now that I've worked past the god awful tint issue I'll probably repurchase.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I really like this sunscreen! I have oily-combo skin and was looking for a matte-finish, but non drying facial sunscreen. This has a universal tint which works well with my skin, and adds the slightest hint of coverage. My skin is oily enough for me to wear this alone (without moisturizer), and it works well with some concealer on top and a light dusting of powder. It keeps me pretty matte all day and I barely need to touch up. 

However, I have tried wearing this by itself with foundation on top, and my skin got uncomfortably dry. If you are a foundation user, make sure to put on lotion underneath. I find that the mattifying effect doesn't work as well with moisturizer under, so play around with it and find what routine works best for you. I've been using it for 2-3 weeks and it hasn't broken me out or irritated my skin.

My only concern with this is the price - it is $32 USD and I live in Canada, so the conversion rates are a little ridiculous. Plus they tack on a $5.00 brokerage fee to each order, so I end up paying around $50+CAD for a bottle of this. I think I would only repurchase if there was a good sale.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: For an SPF product, this gets a holy grail in my book.  I have to be very very very careful what I put on my face.  This is bonifide safe for your face if you have acne prone skin (at least mine and I try a lot).  I can't see myself repurchasing a different SPF anytime soon.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: Oh so madly in love with this! Finally - an all mineral tinted sunscreen that isn't yellow, but truly neutral leaning almost cool. Not all of us are yellow based, and the other tinted sunscreens I've tried - Cotz face natural skintone, Replenix Ultimatte, MD Solar Sciences - are all very yellow, and mostly dry too dark. This one almost seems too light going on, but then seems to adjust to my skin tone as it dries down - and I'm not super pale.  I have dry skin, so I wear a  moisturizer under this, along with a layer of dedicated sunscreen if I'm spending time outside. My skin feels moist all day without being greasy, and looks flawless with a dab of concealer around nose & mouth. This product has 13% zinc oxide, and loads of antioxidants as well, so I feel like I'm doing my skin a favor just applying this. It lasts all day for me and never seems to break down or separate around my nose, where I can sometimes get oily by the end of the day, especially in warm weather. Yeah, I wish it was less expensive. But Paula's Choice has very frequent sales, and I plan to just buy 2 tubes at a time whenever I can save money on it. As far as breakouts go, you'll have them if you don't remove this thoroughly. I cleanse with oil every single night, to completely remove everything I put on my face, plus any dirt, sweat, and pollutants I've accumulated throughout the day. Sometimes I follow that with a foaming face wash, sometimes not, depending on the weather & if I feel unusually oily. The website states that this product is for combination/oily skin, which kept me from trying it for a long time. I wish it had occurred to me sooner that a bit of moisturizer underneath would solve that problem, because I truly never want to be without this ever again. Oh - and the damn cap! That's my only complaint, that the cap doesn't seem to close tight. Like, no satisfying snap or click when you close it. I do carry it in my bag, and have not had any issues with leaking, but I still wished the cap closed more tightly. Overall the packaging is nothing to write home about - fairly utilitarian looking blue plastic. If that keeps costs down, then I'm all for it. Anyway - fantastic stuff - I love it.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: It's my HG sunscreen, I used it almost 5 days a week as sunscreen / tinted moisturizer / foundation, it gives you the second skin look with sheer coverage on the skin, I love it so much that I always stock up extra one to two bottles at home. Love, love love!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
This sunscreen is soooooo amazing! It actually has a matte finish that I don't even need a primer anymore because this sunscreen just keeps my face matte (with minimal oil by the end of day). This is amazing for anyone who has oily skin. Also I love how this doesn't feel sticky at all and doesn't have a shiny finish like other sunscreen! The tint is suitable for most skin tones too (maybe not for darker skin tones?).
This is probably something that I would just continue using for the rest of my life because I have never actually found a sunscreen that mattifies my oily face! LOVE!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Upon the recommendation of my dermatologist I wear sunscreen on my face 365 days of the year. I've tried many brands and formulations and this is one of my all-time favourites. 

My skin is classic combination but prone to being reactive and therefore ruddy. I love how easy this is to apply (it doesn't feel like chalky sunscreen) and how the subtle tint is, just that, subtle. Perhaps too light for anyone with a darker skin tone? 

I apply this after my other PC products and top it off it light dusting of setting powder. 

Pros: fluidity, blendability, and doesn't irritate my skin even around the eye area

Cons: pricey

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
This sunscreen was too drying on my combination skin. It felt tight all day. Even if I moisturize before it isn't enough. Also I could see some 'tan' color on my face. Almost similar to the character 'Oompa Loompa'. The tint color definitely wasn't flattering on my skin, it didn't match my skin tone at all.

Definitely for oily to very oily skin or really resilient skin, because this can be very drying!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
This is a really nice ZnO ss with the added benefit of lots of anti-ageing ingredients.  It's a thin-medium consistency, tinted lotion with no discernible fragrance in a convenient squeeze tube.  The tint is sheer; this is not a high coverage tinted ss like Supergoop!'s CC cream or It Cosmetics' spf50  CC cream.

Pros:  
-Mineral, w/ ZnO, which I find calms my oily, acneic/rosacean/IPL damaged skin 
good everyday UV protection
-does not clog, irritate or break out my skin
-contains anti-oidants and anti-ageing ings
-works well under liquid foundation and powder - no clumping or pilling

Cons:
-Not quite as matte as I would like - I get more shine w/ this than with LRP Mineral spf50, LRP Dry-Touch gel-cream, or PC's renamed Calm Redness Relief Mineral spf30
-color is way too pink for me; looks like calamine lotion on me, but I am super yellow, and I cover this w/ foundation anyway so I don't see the pink.
-slight tendency to crease, but ZnO ss's tend to do this anyway, and this is nowhere near as bad as Cerave's ZnO ss's which crease and clump (and even peel up like Elmer's glue!) very badly.

Overall, excellent everyday ss for oily to normal people looking for a mineral ss w/ some added anti-ageing benefits.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
My skin is sensitive, dry-combination(oily nose, normal cheeks, dry patches), rosacea-prone, very fair.

PROS: I love the tint, it's perfect for my skin tone. It covers my redness and most of the time I don't need to wear foundation over top. When I've prepped my skin properly (see below) my skin looks great. Next, the active ingredients in this SS are effective and I always trust PC for knowing their stuff. Finally, I love that the product did not irritate my skin and doesn't have a strong fragrance.

CONS: It is VERY drying on me. Unless I wear a heavy moisturizing cream underneath, or apply a layer of oil before applying this (I use Seabuckthorn), my skin feels incredibly uncomfortable, tight, and looks really dehydrated. Also, at US$32 plus shipping, it's quite pricey (I am in Canada) and it's inconvenient to have to wait for it in the mail. For me it's quite a "high-maintenance", expensive product, and for that reason I likely won't buy it again. I'll stick to my Avene SS which doesn't dry me out, and I can buy it in-store easily.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
i don't know what to believe anymore. 

see this was my HG sunscreen. it mattifies my oily face, it has a slight tint that brightens my face, and somehow blurs imperfections. i just really loved it.

until i read this:

http://feleciaroselabs.com/is-my-expensive-vitamin-c-serum-killing-my-skin/

and found out that in a study, they found out that palmitic acid in skin care, while it's good for making vitamin c get absorbed, is "catastrophic" to the skin once exposed to the sun.

and i saw "Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate" on the ingredients. which is another term for ascorbyl tetraisopalmitate.

so now i'm legitimately spooked and am now on the hunt for a new hg sunscreen

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
This is the best sunscreen I've ever used! I've been using it for 4 months now.  I have fair combination skin with an occasional or hormonal breakout. I'm on tretinoin so my skin is extra sensitive, and this sunscreen doesn't burn my face at all!  This stuff pretty much feels weightless on my skin and controls any oil in my t-zone throughout the day. It works excellent as a makeup primer as well and helps my makeup last all day, unlike other sunscreens that I've used. It also has a slight tint that looks nice on my skin and slightly blurs minor imperfections.  I'm really wanting to try Paula's spf 50 fluid for the hot and humid summers here. I really love all Paula's Choice products I've ever used and her products along with skincare advice, and beautypedia, have really changed my skin in the best way possible.

During the day time I use Cerave foaming facewash, Paula' Choice Hydralight toner, Clinique dramatically different moisturizing GEL mixed with 2-3 drops of Paula's Choice Vitamin C serum, this Paula's Choice Resist spf 30, let it dry 5 minutes then foundation and the rest of my makeup routine and my skin hasn't been better!!!  At night I like to actually use Paula's Choice for Men night cream with Retinol (good stuff!) or Clinique Moisture surge after my cleansing routing and applying Paula's Choice Skin Perfecting liquid with 2%Bha...the nights I'm not using my tretinoin. On those nights I wait 20min after applying tretinoin then use Clinique moisture surge on top. Love that stuff!

I'm new to this site and hope I can find another great sunscreen and line of products to try!  I'm always looking to try something new even though I would definitely repurchase this sunscreen again. I already have 2 extra backups since it's so hard for me to find sunscreen that works well for my skin.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
pricey but it works!

i use pc's bha gel at night, so i have to use a sunscreen throughout the day.

this is the only one that i'll use on my face. i like the tint, i have some redness in my skin - but after applying this, i can skip foundation. i have been using this for over two years now. never caused any problems. it is rather drying, which works for me - i don't get shiny or oily by the end of the day or after a strenous bike ride in hot weather.

it has a little bit of a smell, not unpleasant but distinct. this goes away after a few moments. 

one tube lasts me about 9 months (but i only apply on days i have to leave the house and be outside a lot.)

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
This is one of the best SPFs I have tried (and I've tried more than I would like to admit). 

A background on my skin: I had chemotherapy at the age of 24 (I am 26 now) which destroyed my skin. I now have extremely sensitive, red, acne prone skin that reacts to anything and everything.  Hence why I try to use mineral sunscreens over chemical and all products I use are for the most sensitive of skin. On top of this, I have combination skin (yay)

The tint is perfect and is just enough to neutralise my redness. It has physical sunscreen which is perfect for my sensitive skin and its not heavy or oily. I don't feel like Im wearing sunscreen at all. It does smell a bit like paint but the smell disappears quite quickly. I don't breakout, I don't get itchy and it doesn't sit on top of my skin but rather blends in perfectly. Its really great for my combination (very sensitive) skin.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: After starting on Retin A last summer my face became ultra sensitive to chemical based sunscreens so I thought I'd give this a try. It goes on very smoothly and does not irritate my skin at all. There is a slight tint but its barely noticeable. Somedays I skip foundation and my face looks fresh. This may be due to the product or that Retin A is working too. Anyway the combination is working for me. I put it on over CeraVe moisturising lotion, I'm on my third bottle and always have a spare one as I don't want to be without it! I have been using Paula's choice products for several years now and the price of her products is certainly going up and bottles are getting smaller but still great products and more cost effective and better performing than some higher end products.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Disclaimer: I am writing this review after only purchasing the sample size of this product. 

For reference, I have dehydrated skin that gets very oily throughout the day. I used this product once and it not only made my skin feel tight and dry, but it definitely accentuated dry patches on my skin. I really wanted to love this product because the tint looked really great, but it was just too drying for me to purchase the full size! If you have very oily skin, I think this would work great for you; stay away if you have any dryness, though!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: Luckily I only bought a couple of samples of this because I hated it. I did not realize this was tinted, which I do not like at all. It's a sheer neutral "beige" color. I don't use foundation, only concealer for spot coverage, so adding color all over my face just felt gross. The formula is light and silky. However, despite having success in keeping my acne prone skin clear for ages now, after using this, I developed 2 huge red zits and several smaller ones. This product was the only change that I made, so I'm pretty sure this is what caused the flare up. What a shame, because this looked so promising on the website. If you don't have issues with acne and like tinted products, you might like this, it just wasn't for me. Paula's products are hit or miss for me, and this one is a huge miss. :(

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: Works like no other sunscreen I've used. I have combo skin and this works perfectly under foundation helping to keep my t-zone shine free. Highly recommend. Always come back to this after trying other sun protection products.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I am required to use a sunscreen as noted by my physician because I use Retin-A, Benzoyl Peroxide, and Clindamycin (and birth control) to control my adult hormonal acne from hell. I hate sunscreen because none of them that I've tried does a good job at protecting my skin and they feel horribly sticky/oily. This is the only sunscreen I can use that does not burn the hell out of my skin (due to chemical sunscreen) or turn me white as a ghost (due to physical sunscreen) or make my skin feel sticky/oily. The tint used to reduce the white cast from the zinc oxide provide enough color to do the job well and I have cafe au lait colored skin. It goes on like a cream and mattifies very quickly to make your skin feel dry. I use this consistently, daily and have noticed my sun spots fading (thank you Retin-A as well). It also has antioxidants that are supposed to fight free radical damage to the skin; I'm still not sold on this so I don't care much about the antioxidant ingredients, as long as they don't make me break out (which they don't). My only wish is that they included Titanium Dioxide along with the Zinc Oxide to provide a better full spectrum physical sunscreen that can repel the rays from a supernova. Until that time, I will continue to use this product cause it gives me life.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I guess this is a BB cream as it has some tint and provides a bit of coverage & blurring for me. I've been using it since summer and found it keeps the oil at bay. It is a bit drying during the winter months, so I blend it about 50/50 with Paula's Choice RESIST Ultra-Light Super Antioxidant Concentrate Serum. It works great by itself or beneath a light layer of mineral powder foundation. It is the best sunscreen option I have found when trying to wear make-up, so it's worth the price to me.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: This is the only foundation that I have found to be light enough for my fair skin. Love the sheer coverage, moisturizer and sunscreen.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
i love paula's product, i use several of her products
but i really hate this sunblock, because its whitecast, a big no no for me
it doesnt break me out, control my oil, need serum/moisturizer before apply this, because it can be so dry and hard to apply in the face

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
This is one of my all-time holy grails of any product ever. I have severely dry skin with plenty of eczema, yet I also get an oily t-zone, especially in warm weather. It is very hard to find products to satisfy my entire face. I used to use Clinique City Block Sheer with great success, but they must have changed the formula because now it triggers my eczema.

The Resist Super-light is a mineral sunscreen/tinted moisturizer that dries down matte but does not dry out my skin in any way. I do use a good moisturizer underneath, as my skin is VERY dry. It is slightly tinted so no white cast. It does even out the skin tone ever so slightly, as any tinted moisturizer would do. It would be great if they came out with different shades, but honestly it is so sheer you can't even notice that it leans pink (the tint is there to neutralize the white cast). It is amazing for eczema prone skin, or any skin! I can use this in the summer or Canadian winter. Feels like nothing on the face. Loaded with antioxidants. Love love love!!!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
There are only a handful of products that I repurchase.  Usually I shop around trying to find something better - ever hopeful.  I'm giving this 5 lippies because I'm repurchasing.

It just seems to do exactly what it's supposed to do for me.  Even though it's only very lightly tinted (hardly at all really), it instantly makes my skin look a little better.  On the weekends, I can go with this project with no other face makeup.  For work I wear either liquid foundation over it, or powder, and it plays well with both.  (With the exception of my Armani foundation which doesn't go well over anything else, so I don't blame this Resist sunscreen for that problem).

It's not shiny, but also not too matte - i.e., it doesn't look dry and powdery.  And it doesn't cause me to break out.

The only downside is the price, which seems a little high for the size of the tube.  But still, I throw away so much product that doesn't work, paying this price for something I will actually use makes it worthwhile.

I'm in my 60's, so I don't expect miracles. I'm just happy when something works for me.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
My skin is normal leaning dry, and my climate is cold. However, the summer months here are quite hot and it can be very humid sometimes. I bought this to use as a summer moisturizer. I had previously used the Hydralight day cream and loved it, but wanted to try this new RESIST product that has a tint. 

I love this lotion because of the slight gel-cream texture and the mattifying effect it has on the face, while still making my skin very soft. It does not break me out or irritate me in any way, and because it features a natural sunscreen, I can apply it around the eye area with no stinging. 

A note on the tint in this product- it is not a "tinted moisturizer" in the sense of how we think of TMs these days (i.e. a light makeup/foundation product with some skin care benefits). This product is a moisturizer first and foremost and cannot be considered makeup. The tint is very sheer and is meant only to eliminate the white cast of the zinc oxide sunscreen. For this, the tint works very well, and it is so subtle I wouldn't be surprised if darker-skinned people could also wear this product. However, the tint does little to nothing to even out skin tone or hide discolourations. I did take this lotion on a trip to Greece and wore it instead of foundation most days, simply because I wanted to cut down on the amount of products I took with me. However, I still needed concealer for my under eye area. My skin is very clear, but if I had been broken out I wouldn't have gotten away with just wearing this lotion instead of foundation.

This is one of the pricier creams in Paula's line. While it is clearly a very good moisturizer, I am not sure if I like it that much more than the much cheaper Hydralight lotion. Hydralight has no tint but I don't think it leaves a white cast on my face either, perhaps because I am so fair. Overall I think I prefer the texture of the RESIST lotion to Hydralight, and based on the ingredients RESIST probably has better anti-aging properties, but I'm not sure it justifies the price difference. 

I have yet to see if this lotion is moisturizing enough for my winter skin. I did buy another tube so I will try it out and update.

I would recommend this lotion if your skin liked the Hydralight lotion, or if you needed something like Hydralight and found it came up short. RESIST Super-Light is marketed toward oily skin, but slightly dry-skinned folks like me can also benefit if the climate is right.  

UPDATE: This lotion is definitely not suitable for my winter skin. I found my face getting quite dry as the mercury dropped, so I switched over to the Hydralight and that seems to have fixed the problem. Hydralight is actually quite nourishing for an "oily skin" lotion; RESIST Super-Light is definitely lighter and not as moisturizing. So I still definitely recommend Super-Light if Hydralight was too heavy for you or broke you out. Personally I'd still consider it for summer.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
So I got this product because as its stated on the bottle, its for combination skin and super light moisturizer with spf. Well, this product is for you if:
1. you have very oily skin and need a mattifying sunscreen.
2. You have combo/oily and live in very hot weather that your face becomes an oil mess.
3. You dont mind any smell or tint in a product as this product has a slight tint with whitish residues and has a slight unpleasant smell in my opinion.

As a result, I returned this product, because I live in a cold weather place that my combo skin became dry now. Second, its not moisturizing what so ever. Third, I hate the smell. Fourth, if I layer it with other moisturizeres, it breaks me out.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I love this sunscreen, and tbh it's the only one that really keeps me vigilant about sun protection. I paid $32 for a 2oz tube, which is fairly pricey, but I'm about 1/3 done with it and have been using it allll summer. It provides an SPF of 30 from 13% zinc oxide and contains antioxidants and reservatrol for extra goodness. Packaging is utilitarian as hell, but I don't care one whit.

The reasons I put forth the effort to use it: 

- The zinc oxide provides non-icky physical sun protection (chemical sunscreens weird me out) while being excellent for my skin overall, as zinc helps with acne and other unsavory skin thingies.
- The sheer tint negates that white cast from the zinc, and while it is VERY sheer it somehow does a great job of blurring imperfections and dimishing redness. I wear this under a base most days but it would not be inconceivable for me to wear it alone.
- It's my favorite primer, hands down: mattifies, blurs, smooths, and extends the life of my makeup better than all regular primers I've tried. Feels like a primer on skin too, no tackiness, greasiness, or heaviness.
- It has never ever broken me out or anything similar, it does contain 'cones which my skin can be sensitive to but I've had no issues. (This is probably why it feels like a primer, haha.)
- Has never irritated the delicate eye area, I use it directly on my lids with no problems whatsoever, including getting on my contacts, which is something I can't say for like, anything else I use.

In short, meld keeping my skin healthy with my insufferable desire for short-term gratification and vanity and I will apply it daily!

I honestly have nothing bad to say about it. I imagine if you have very dry skin this might not be the best option for you. 10/10 will repurchase.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I love this soo much! This is the only sunscreen I've tried that doesn't break me out. It goes on matte and stays quite matte throughout the day (some people say it's very "drying") without seeming flat. It doesn't irritate my eyes at all (I use it right under my eyes and sometimes on my eyelids). The sheer tint reduces redness and creates a smoother complexion. It is a little pricey but it lasts many months (~4) and is worth it. 
I put it on after cleansing, toning (PC skin balancing), and exfoliating (PC Clear regular strength).

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: This is the best face sunscreen I've found so far that doesn't use chemical sunscreens, which I avoid.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Love, love LOVE this lightly tinted sunscreen, and that's just what it is.  It's 13% zinc oxide--the reason at 44, my skin has very few mild wrinkles (using it daily 20+ years)--and tinted, which overrides the frequent whitish cast of zinc.  It's chock-full of antioxidants & soothing extracts.  My dry skin adores it, and the tinting is so slight that it's imperceptible.

Bear in mind a few things:

1.  Zinc oxide:  yes, your skin will likely feel like it can't "breathe," at least until you get used to it.  This is because zinc is a PHYSICAL blocker of UVA/UVB rays but also pollutants, and it has skin-healing properties (which is why you see it in high doses in diaper cream & other products used, for example, in the elderly & those with paralysis/wheelchair-bound who are not ambulatory & suffer skin breakdown from pressure points).  It is the strongest sunscreen you can get.  Avobenzone, a chemical sunscreen, breaks down within two hours of UV exposure so you have to reapply it.  I use it often on my arms & legs, but I keep a spray (Australian Gold--it has no drying alcohol like all the others) on hand to reapply.

2.  Oily skin:  this simply may not work since zinc does have a greasiness to it, BUT, if you really want to be aggressive on maintaining your skin, that's the trade off.  (See below about Paula's compact powder).  My skin will get "glowy" by the end of the day, or midway through during our uber hot & humid summers down here, but I'm not bothered by it since I can blot most with a tissue & I'd rather look younger than like worn leather shoe.  

3.  Don't expect coverage.  It's very light at best & would even out only very mild discolorations on fair-to-medium skin.  It is NOT a foundation & does not claim to be:  it is a lightly tinted SUNSCREEN.  Heavy duty too.

I gave up liquid foundation years ago since it always looked cakey & was like a neon sign to the lines I have, switching to a dusting of powder instead (Paula's powder foundation is fabulous AND offers zinc & titanium dioxide protection, so you get an extra layer).  

It's definitely worth trying if you can manage through wearing a high level of zinc oxide, and will afford your skin the best products available.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
This is easily the most cosmetically elegant sunscreen I've ever used, and I've used sooo many sunscreens over the years. It truly leaves a matte finish and it serves nicely as a makeup primer. I like the tint and love that there is no white cast to the skin after applying. I've experienced no irritation or breakouts.
My only gripe is the price. It's expensive for the small amount you get. You should be applying a generous amount daily to get adequate protection so the product gets used up fairly quickly when used as directed. This is especially disappointing coming from Paula Begoun because she has slammed other companies in the past for the exact same thing.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I have terrible trouble getting sunscreen that's right for my skin, it was basically impossible before this product existed. Almost all my boxes are ticked by it; fragrance free, non greasy, alcohol free, "physical" sunscreen, cruelty free, full of antioxidants and beneficial ingredients, doesn't seem to clog my pores or cause spots, matte finish but not drying/doesn't emphasise dryer areas. Basically perfect. The only thing I don't like is the tint, I'd much prefer a colourless sunscreen. It's also a bit on the dark side for my pale olive skin so I have to mix it with Paula's colourless Hydralight sunscreen. Ideally I'd give four and half lippies for that reason. Hydralight is slightly oily on its own but mixed with Resist they make the perfect texture. Obviously that means buying both at once, but then it lasts twice as long, so it doesn't really make a difference to the price.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
A physical sunscreen that feels more like a high end cosmetic primer. I am extremely picky when it comes to facial sunscreens, and this one is just about perfect: very light wearing, matte, invisible, no animal testing. It feels like nothing once it's on and doesn't rub off or transfer. Huge bonuses for being also a physical block and having sample sizes available.

As a makeup primer, it also does its job very well. It's very mattifying, and the slight tint does make the surface of my skin look more even. It does go on pinkish but the colour disappears into my pale yellow toned skin. I put concealer and a bit of powder on top, but without the additional makeup I wouldn't need any powder at all. I don't think I've said that about ANY sunscreen or primer before!

The only negatives are the price and the cheap-looking packaging, however this product performs so well that I feel the price is worth it.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I wanted this to work for me but in the end it did not agree with my oily skin. 
It made me more shiny and made my makeup slip around more. 
The light tint does not offer coverage. 
My skin felt like it could not breath. 
Only gave 2 lippies because it has ingredients that are good for skin and of course SPF. 
I did not notice any improvement in skin using this and in the end my complexion looked weighed down, tired, and dull.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Wow. This is an exceptional physical sunscreen - for all skin types. There is no shine or white cast, it's not drying, and it's non irritating and hasn't caused any breakouts. Oh, and when I use this, the redness and discolouration on my face is less evident (even when I remove it I mean). 

This does have a tint, but not enough to provide any real colour. If anything, it functions like an extremely lightweight tinted moisturiser. I like to wear it with alone or under makeup, as it makes no difference to the finish or longevity of my makeup. 

This does have an odd smell, kind of like liquorice... but not sweet. I can't say I'm fond of it, but it doesn't hinder the quality of the product, and the scent dissipates once I've finished applying it.

I really can't say enough good things about this. I was previously using Shiseido city block spf30, which was great, but it still left a slight sheen and the alcohol content worried me.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I really wanted to love this sunscreen, and I did for a while, but whenever I use this consistently I get tiny bumps all over my skin. It's great for oily skin because it dries to a matte finish, and it would have been a holy grail for me.

I've tried it on several different occasion but always get the stubborn little bumps that take a few weeks to resolve- I'm thinking I must have a sensitivity to one of the ingredients.

Still on the hunt for a good sunscreen for oily skin.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Fast-forward a year....I need to change this review.  It was another Paula's Choice product that destroyed my skin--Resist Barrier Repair containing Retinol.  The Resist Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense SPF 30 is a wonderful product for normal to oily skin or combination skin.  I use it on my nose, which is my only oily part. It melts right in and improves the look of the skin on my nose.  It looks matte and smooth.  I will repurchase it and use it only on my nose from now on.  The reason I didn't give it 5 lippies is because it isn't moisturizing enough for the rest of my face, so I have to purchase two different daytime moisturizers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

I thought this would be suitable for a daily sunscreen with light moisture for my combo skin in the spring and summer, but this stuff was a terrible disaster for my skin! I usually have trouble-free skin, but when I switched to Paula's Choice my skin got destroyed. Bumps, flaking like crazy, and small red spots. I almost wondered if I had developed rosacea.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
my HG for winter
it.s just perfect for my oily/combination, acne prone , sensitive skin
 to bad it.s just spf 30 
the only problem i have with it it.s that tint kinda shows on my fair face but i use powder foundation over it and it.s ok
i.m using it as a sunscreen only so i have to put another serum or cream under it because it.s to dry for me in the winter.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I have super oily skin and I LOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE this sunscreen!! I prefer mineral sunscreens because they are way less irritating, but they are usually pretty shiny. But this is matte! How did they do that?! It does have a slight tint to it but won't give you any coverage, though I like to mix a little creme foundation into it and it looks great (foundation+sunscreen+antioxidants= hell yes!). I think the tint might be apparent on people who are really pale or really dark, but for most people it's fine. I've gone through like 4 bottles and just got 2 more.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: Ugh. I used this about a year ago. Not a pleasant memory. It was soooo drying for my skin. Like kind of greasy looking at first but then it somehow sucked all the moisture out of my skin. And it settled into fine lines where I didn't know I had fine lines. And the "tint" was way too dark for me and I thought it was for all skintones. I applied moisturizer under this, couldn't even help with the dryness. I had bought 2 bottles of this thinking it would be great but I ended up not using the second bottle-or even finishing the first one...I gave it a good effort though. Im giving it a 2 instead of a 1 only because it didn't do any damage to my face...it just looked awful when it was on. Frowny face

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I'm quite surprised that so many people with various skin types like this because in my experience this is only suitable for people with oily skin. Physical sunscreens suck out the moisture from my skin, and in this case there is nothing to counteract the drying effect. I couldn't wait to wash it down in the evening, it was so drying, although I used it with the Skin Recovery moisturizer without SPF. 
The texture is quite runny, but it solidifies quickly after the application, forming a kind of mask that has to be bombed down with a good make-up remover at the end of the day. It has a slight tint, which is a nice color, unnoticeable, if you use a small amount, but when I applied it liberally, I could see the border of the product by my ears and my neck, because it was too dark. It is extremely mattifying, which must be a huge plus for people with very oily skin, but it looked unnatural on me. 
To sum it up, I think it's a good product, but only for people with oily skin. If you have dry skin, try the Cellular Defense from the Resist line, if your skin is normal or combination, I recommend Clinique's City Block SPF 25.

Edited to add: For my normal/dry skin I can use it with Paula's Oil Booster. It works fine this way.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
This is in the sunscreen category on here, but I use this as a primer, after my serum. The fact that it contains sunscreen is great because it gets 2 jobs done in one!

I have really oily skin and this keeps my make up on for the whole day. It does not however moisturise very well, so probably not good for people with dry skin.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I tried a sample of this and the next day ordered the full size. It evens out your skin tone just a tad and has a matte finish. I have very sensitive, acne prone skin and have been using this for a month and it hasn't caused me to break out.  I can wear this alone and it actually makes my skin look better! I love that bc I have 2 young kids and I often don't have time to put makeup on, but I feel guilty being outside without any sunscreen on my face. Now I can just slap some of this on and go, and just do my makeup later. It's a great primer under foundation!  Highly recommend it!!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I have combination skin with some very oily patches and some very dry patches. This product did not work at all on the dry patches: it highlighted flaky skin really badly. On the oily parts of my face, it was great: it made my skin smooth, soft and matte. However, I won't be repurchasing this because I couldn't use it at all on the dry areas--I had to use a different product altogether on these areas of my face.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Nope this started breaking me out and I can't handle the dry clay face feel. It also does not work well with makeup over it. I am very sorry I bought a back-up tube of this.


I've come around on this sunscreen. I used it all summer when my skin was combination and it was great. The tint is a little off-putting because it is pink but once it's rubbed in it disappears. And I had to get used to the texture which felt very occlusive due to the high level of zinc--very mask-like--but once I did I liked it because it didn't irritate my rosacea and helped to dry some breakouts. The tint just blurs my skin but I still need concealer.

It is pretty expensive but all of PC's prices have gone up. But I have repurchased. I like it better than the sheer matte TM which runs too yellow and oxidizes orange on me. My other favorite is the Hydralight SPF which also works well with my finicky skin. Someone mentioned mixing the hydralight with the Resist. I'm going to try that.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I've been using this product for almost a week now.  I hardly ever write reviews...UNLESS, I find the most amazing product!!!  I have melasma and have been on the hunt for the perfect moisturizer with spf for a few years.  I ran across this product and ordered about five samples to test it out.  The first day I wore it, I was amazed!!!  Needless to say, I just placed an order for a full size tube!  it's very lightweight, absorbs quickly, has anti-aging benefits, smooths large pores, controls my super oily skin all day, evens out my skin tone...and most important, doesn't leave any signs that you're wearing sunscreen!  This product is a true winner for me, and I'm VERY particular about my skincare products!  Give it a try, you won't be disappointed...you'll actually be AMAZED!!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Just bought this a few days ago and I'm a covert!

I used to use the Biore aqua SPF but that started to dry out my skin and I decided to turn back to trust Paula's choice for a sunscreen. 

This sunscreen is lightweight and acts as a makeup primer as well and I just apply my bb cream over. Don't be afraid of the tint as it evens out the skin tone and can't be seen! 

Overall, like all Paula's choice products, it's good for the skin and didn't cause me any breakouts.

Oh, the smell takes getting used to but its a small issue!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: It's probably the only sunscreen I will ever use because it's simply the best. If you prefer mineral sunscreens, there are no other sunscreens to match the quality of this one. Think of it like a lotion-to-powder formula. You blend it out like a normal lotion and after about a minute it's as weightless as powder. I apply a LOT of this and it is never heavy or patchy. There's no white cast like other mineral sunscreens because of the slight tint. The tint is a little light for me but it matches to my skin tone after a few minutes. There's also an added plus of anti-ageing ingredients in it.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
Pros - The tint isn't obtrusive. It isn't quite on the level of a BB cream. Instead, it is meant to prevent the "white cast" that otherwise comes with mineral sunscreens - and I actually love the very sheer tint. Very gentle, even around the eyes. Leaves a dewy, semi-matte finish.

Cons - Small amount for the price, considering that you must use liberally to get proper sun protection. Not moisturizing enough for dry skin without using a separate moisturizer. Unfortunately, there is no comparable PC product for dry skin. 

Due to the size/price ratio and the fact that I must use a separate moisturizer, I'm currently looking for a different product. If PC elected to make this in a larger size, for a better price, and in a formula suitable for dry to very dry skin, it would be my HG.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: For me, this is the same as a BB or CC. The color is a good match and all I do is apply powder (Flower PP1, Prestige in Wheat, or Nuance in Light/Medium) when this has been brushed on. I am an NW20 and all of these work since they're so neutral. Nice, right? Well, since the Resist is $29.00 and there are so many other, less costly, options out there, I wouldn't waste my money on this. Paula's products are just what she used to target other companies for. Soon she'll be selling out to Estee Lauder or L'Oreal.....

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I really enjoy this as a daytime moisturizer/SPF over any serum and under a light foundation.  It's lightweight and blends in easily. It's slightly tinted and leaves a clean matt finish with no stickiness at all. Well packaged in a tube and easy to dispense. Highly recommend.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I got a sample and wanted to love this, but it's just not right for me. I mostly like what's in it (and what's not in it) but it leaves a scummy type coating on my skin and clung to a few dry patches. It smells relatively neutral, but slightly metallic? It DID do a good job of keeping my face relatively matte all day, so for someone not living in New England winter it may be a winner. It's heavy on dimethicone, and although I can tolerate dimethicone at lower concentrations, I did get a few whiteheads on my otherwise calm skin after two days of wearing this (and changing nothing else). Not for me, sadly! I'll be finishing my Missha All Around Safe Block Mild Essence Sun Milk for now and courting new fragrance-free options elsewhere.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I have tried and loved Paula's products so when it was time to replace my daily use sunscreen, I checked out Paula. I wanted something with a high-enough SPF for Florida and lucky for me I don't have to pay a whole bunch of attention to the ingredients.  Just happy she does not test on animals and that the refund policy is very good.
Anyway, 30 SPF should be enough for daily use, meaning environmental exposure, walking to car, casual outdoor time.  Any more exposure than that I always go to a "real" sunscreen.
The packaging is fab, its a narrow tip tube that dispenses moderately so you don't get a big "SPLOOSH" out.  The color to me is a cream-ish/white; other reviewers say this shows up on your skin but I don't notice it. I hope I'm using enough!  Feel is smooth but not silky/silicone.
It leaves my skin slightly matte, which I like.  Then I use Paula's tinted sunscreen..I know, I know, that sounds like overkill but I don't want alot of color, and I do so like her products. I'm very diligent when using the RESIST, I use it everyday even if I don't put on any other makeup.  Just part of my routine.   It seems to stay fairly matte thruout the day, but I do finish my routine with Lucy's Minerals, so it could be that too.  Paula's has not failed me; my daughter is using the acne products and having very good results too.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I am very conflicted on this sunscreen. I wish it had higher UVA protection like French or Asian sunscreens (but I blame the FDA for that, not Paula's Choice). HOWEVER, everything else about this sunscreen is perfect.

First, there is no greasiness at all. It reminds me a lot of those "liquid-to-powder" foundations. It feels like it dries down immediately, similarly to Asian sunscreens except Paula somehow manages to do it without the alcohol. Amazing.

Second, it is slightly tinted so I actually stopped wearing tinted moisturizer. I wear the proper amount (1/4 tsp) and it does NOT look cakey at all, unlike tinted moisturizers with SPF if I try to wear the same amount. There's no white cast at all. However, I am NC20. I can see the tint being a problem for darker skintones.

Also, no fragrance! Yay!

The only reason I will stick to French and Asian sunscreens is the superior UVA protection. I am still on the hunt for the perfect sunscreen, but this one has come closer to perfect than any other sunscreen I have tried.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I find this the best mineral based sunscreen for oily skin. I tried other PC products also but this is the only one that doesn't make my face oily at midday. Also in my opinion this could be a perfect makeup primer as the foundations settles and stay there perfectly.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: Just bought this as my moisturizer after reading good reviews. I have very oily skin and this is my HG for a moisturizer before my makeup. I applied some on after washing my makeup off last night and woke up this morning still matte! Amazing product. It does have an interesting tint to it but once you apply your foundation over it, it blends right in. Please never discontinue!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I like the consistency of this; it feels creamy but is still mattifying without drying me out. You also can't beat the broad spectrum UV protection. Because it's mineral based, it's gentle enough to use on the eye area. My only complaint about this that the tint does not work for all skin tones as Paula's Choice claims. It is too dark for me, and I imagine it must be too light for people with darker skin. It would be great if this were sold in multiple shades.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I'm always on the hunt for a zinc based facial  sun screen that blends right I to  my light Olive-y skin tone. so based on reviews I decided to give this a try......and a miss. 

It's a nice texture, and non irritating. A bit dehydrating for winter, but would be good in summer. 

Except.....it's just too pink. And a touch light...like the tint is really meant for people with super fair complexions. It's not universal at all. It's for pale, cool toned fair skinned folks. 

If I am going to have to add the extra step of a product on top to correct color, I don't see why I need to start with a $29 per small tube of sunscreen. Blue lizard face is super whitening,mouth less drying and cheaper. MD solar sciences bb cream is a bit more expensive, but the tint is dead on.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I stockpile this product because I don't ever want to be without. It's my go-to sunscreen. I have tried other face SPFs from higher-price boutique brands but I keep returning to this particular product because:

1) price is reasonable
2) I trust Paula with regards to effective overall UVA/UVB sun protection 
3) the product is not tested on animals.

I literally have ordered five at a time when this product goes on sale. It's fabulous for oily skin, as it mattifies slightly but certainly doesn't add any oiliness. It's gorgeous under foundation or with no foundation at all.

I highly recommend. One of the best Paula's Choice products there is, in my opinion.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: Very nice SPF that does not feel greasy, sticky, itchy or gives me teary eyes. No white face upon application! It has a nice matte effect, but is not very moisturizing (maybe it is enough in summer, though).  I do need some kind of cream underneath, especially during winter. I even can go without foundation since this has a bit of a neutral colour. Just some concealer here and there and I am good to go! Good job Paula Begoun!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
How I love this product. It really feels light but slightly moisturising, have worn this in cold weather without becoming dry and flaky. The slight tint helps and the lotion feels gorgeous on the skin. 
It's like a light moisturising version of my adored Clinique's City block, that I use in the summer.
Love.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: I REALLY wanted to love this product as I love a lot of other Paula's Choice products. However, it made me break out in cystic acne (which I haven't had in years). I also found the tint was a little too light for my skin tone. So, I ended up looking a little chalky/cakey after I put my regular powder over top. I'm a huge lover of PC face washes and sunscreens but this one just didn't fit the bill for me!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: This is a terrific moisturizer. I was a little skeptical at first because I'm very devoted to my drugstore choices, Neutrogena and Cerave, but I had a sample of this and the texture blew me away. It's a very light lotion and it's faintly tinted- not enough to give me any significant color as a NW20, light-medium complexion. I think those who are lighter than me might notice more of a difference with the tint. At any rate, the lotion is tinted slightly I think to cover up the white-ish cast that lotions with sun protection tend to have. This is very effective. The texture is light and fluffy and the squeeze container (pointed down) is a perfect second to having an air-pump. On me, the lotion absorbs very fast and leaves a wonderful silky (but not silicone-y) feel to my skin. It feels hydrated and clean. Perfect for all the seasons but maybe in the most humid or coldest weather I might need to change up for something lighter or heavier respectively. A great buy- $29 for 2 oz which should last me a good three months with 1x/daily use.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: Doesn't dry out my skin and doesn't break me out. More importantly, I can wear this on my neck and my chest with out it burning and itching like crazy. Even the Blue Lizard "chemical free" stuff caused an allergic reaction on my neck and chest when I wore it. When I first received the sample of this, the pink tint turned me off. I have a yellow, tan tone on my Asian skin and I didn't think it work, but once it settled, I didn't even need to wear any foundation. All I needed was some concealer under my eyes and a dab of blush or bronzer. I also jog with this stuff on. Paula's staff said it's somewhat waterproof and their right. I jog 3 to 4 miles in LA heat  and still see the film on my face when I'm done. I love this stuff.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
OK basically this is a very nice sunscreen with one major drawback (apart from price).It has 13% zinc oxide as active ingredient, which is unusual but nice for those of us who are not fans of titanium dioxide or chemical agents. I would prefer a higher SPF, but possibly this is a question of cosmetic elegance of the end product because zinc oxide in high concentrations is quite thick and claggy. So, OK for an everyday s/s but not to go out in the sun (I have melasma). 

It is indeed very light in texture and easy to apply. There is no discernible shine. The texture is not moisturising though, so for my combination skin I still need to apply a light moisturizer underneath. 

Now the downside: the tint is anything but natural - it's actually a greyish pink! Seriously, on my pale yellow toned skin it looks just awful. It is very sheer, true - but it still does have a subtle effect. Please Paula, why can't you create a pale yellow option for those of us who have yellow-toned skin (or need a bit of subtle colour correcting, i.e. the pink face-yellow neck syndrome...) !! Do that and I swear, I'll buy this by the cartload. As it is, alas, I won't.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review: Oh, how I love this sunscreen! I used to use Skinceuticals physical fusion, but I think this PC product is so much better! It is nearly perfect: 13% zinc oxide, antioxidants, controls oil yet not drying (if I wear moisturizer underneath), and no white cast. My complexion is n15 and the tint is fine for me and I like how it evens out my skin tone a bit. I still use foundation, though. My only criticisms: it claims to moisturize but found it drying when used on its own, the finish can feel a little tacky, and it's not officially water resistant. However, according to a company rep the product is water resistant but was not put through tests to earn the water resistant label.  If they ever discontinue this, I will be so upset because nothing else compares! I use it daily on my face, neck, and chest.

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
it's a miracle, i have finally found a sunscreen that DOESN'T BREAK ME OUT!!  for me, this is unheard of!   it is also SUPER GENTLE.  i have very sensitive skin. i love the tint, which is extremely suddle.  it seems to even out my skin tone without changing the color of my skin at all.  i am nw20.   texture is great, finish looks very nice (not shiny at all).  packaging is convenient and hygienic.  formula has lots of skin beneficial ingredients.  paula's choice doesn't test on animals.

my favorite and i wear it daily!

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
I use this as my foundation (tinted moisturizer) and totally love it.  It gives me just the right amount of sheer coverage to even out my skin tone without masking my natural skin texture or marks, etc.  I use just one layer in the morning, but it is buildable to a more medium coverage.  I initially used this *as* sunscreen, but after some research I realized I should just purchase a separate sunscreen and use this on top (the pea-size amount I use daily isn't enough of the product to get the advertised SPF).  I do like having the extra bit of protection throughout the day, though.  My favorite application method is to dot it across my face, then use a buffing brush to stipple it on, and finally buff it in gently.  

Pros: 
* natural finish
* applies evenly; blends well
* buildable
* doesn't settle into lines/creases
* great price
* long-lasting
* great for 5 minute make-up days (just this, blush, and some mascara, perfect!)

Cons: 
* very light coverage
* not enough SPF

productName: RESIST Super-Light Daily Wrinkle Defense Broad Spectrum SPF 30 - Normal/Oily/Combination Skin
review:
To answer "...would you buy this product again?"...Yes, I have purchased twice as back ups.  I'm not sure how this will do once real winter dryness kicks in.  I have dry skin normally and have been able to use this during that late summer/early fall with a moisturizer underneath.  I am sensitive to chemical sunscreen, but the physical sunscreens for dry skin are just so heavy.  If I need to switch to a dry skin formulation this winter I will, and then gladly come back to this for spring, summer, and fall.  This works very well as sunscreen and primer.  It wears well under a variety of foundations I have tried it with.  It blends in easily and doesn't leave a white cast or feel heavy.  It is fragrance free, another area of sensitivity for me.  I really enjoy it.

UPDATE (12/16/2014):  my skin started to feel dry and tight, and foundation looked horrid as we entered into fall/winter weather.  I switched to a more rich formula and hated it!  I couldn't wait to wash my face.  Paula's Choice released Resist Intensive Relief Cream and the Resist Oil Booster which I started to use.  (I love these BTW.). Adding a more moisturizing base has allowed me to run back to this!  It wears well, and is fabulous under foundation.  I will use this year round!  

Oh yes, it is effective sunscreen.  I have attended several fall outdoor sporting events and my face hasn't burned or darkened.
